title: What are the different types of fascination and their origins according to Del Rio and other authors?
first_phrase: In the previous text, Del Rio categorizes the concept of fascination into three groups: Poetica seu Vulgaris, Philosophica, and Magica. In this final part (200 tokens), some notable works related to fascination are mentioned, such as Vario's "de fascino" treaty, which discusses nations and animals with this power, as well as Olao Magno's "Historia de le genti et de la Natura delle cose Settentrionali" and Pomponazzo's "De naturalium effectuum admirandum etc." Additionally, references to different structures used in magical practices are brought up, such as magical arrows and their effects on individuals.
content: 7. parlando di alcuni istrumenti magici della Botnia, dice dei Finni e dei Lapponi - né manco di forza od efficacia, si dicono avere, nel far nascere agli uomini diverse infermità, con le quali facciano venir meno. E per ciò fare fabbricano alcune magiche et incantate saette di piombo, al modo di un dito, e quelle avventano poi in qualsivoglia luogo, contra coloro dei quali voglion far vendetta. Quelli che son percossi subito si sentono nascere in una gamba o in un braccio una piaga a modo di un cancro, dal dolore della quale in tre dì al più si muoiono.
last_phrase: In conclusion, while tales of magical and enchanted tools may seem like myths and legends of the past, many cultures across history have believed in them and used them for various purposes. The power of suggestion and belief has led people to believe that they can manipulate reality, causing harm or influencing actions. It is essential to remember to take such stories with a grain of salt, but also to acknowledge the cultural significance and historical context in which they arise.
